title: Dad’s Fruitcake
ingredients: One 6-ounce can of Frozen Orange Juice; or, 3 ounces of orange juice + three ounces of red wine (or maraschino cherry liquid)
½ Cup each of Red and Green Cherries (total of one cup)
One cup of mixed candied fruits and peels (or ½ pound total of candied fruits & peels)
instructions: Combine the orange juice, molasses, and raisins.  Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally until the mixture boils.  Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes.  Remove from the heat and stir in the candied fruits and peel.
Cream the butter, sugar and eggs; beating after each egg.  Sift together flour, soda, and the spices and stir into the creamed butter mixture.  Add the fruit and nuts and mix well.

Line a loaf pan (32¼) with wax paper.  Extend the wax paper up and over the sides.  Fill the lined loaf pan ¾ full and bake in a very slow oven (275 F.) for 2¼ to 2½ hours for larger loaf pans or 1½ hours for smaller loaf pans.

Wrap in foil or plastic and store in a cool place for a week.  After a week put paper towels soaked in wine or brandy around each loaf and rewrap.  Again place in a cool place for a week.  (May need to refresh the wine or brandy periodically.)
Yield:  Makes about 3½ pounds of fruit cake.
